entry.title: Setting up the Windows PowerShell profile
entry.content:
Here's how to make the Windows PowerShell command-line prompt use the Visual Studio 2012 environment variables and settings:

  1. We have to start by allowing the loading of PowerShell configuration and profile files, which is disabled by default. So, execute the following in a PowerShell window started with admin rights (confirm you want to change the execution policy when prompted): Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted
  2. Copy the PowerShell profile file from spikes/shells/Windows/Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1 into My Documents/WindowsPowerShell, maintaining the exact filename.
